content.webTitle: Beckham tipped for Golden Ball accolade

fields.headline: Beckham chases the Golden Ball
fields.bodyText: France have the highest number of players, including the Arsenal trio of Patrick Vieira, Thierry Henry and Robert Pires, among the 50 nominees for the 2001 European Footballer of the Year award. Eight more Frenchmen - Fabien Barthez, Vincent Candela, Eric Carriere, Marcel Desailly, Bixente Lizarazu, Lilian Thuram, David Trezeguet and Zinedine Zidane - are also on the list for the Golden Ball, awarded annually by the magazine France Football. Portugal's Real Madrid striker Luis Figo was successful last year and the 2001 winner will be named in the week before Christmas after a poll of journalists. Roma's coach Fabio Capello believes David Beckham is a strong candidate. "I like Beckham. He has grown a lot as a player," said Capello, tipped to become Sir Alex Ferguson's successor as the manager of Manchester United. Capello said his other choice would be Real Madrid's Spanish forward Raul.
